name: src/_reduce.js
_reduce
description:
Applies the accumulator function iteratively on the last return value of the
accumulator and the next value in the input iterable. The initial value is
the initializer parameter.
examples: _reduce( ( x , y ) => x + y , range( 10 ) , 0 ) ; // returns 45
_reduce( ( x , y ) => x + y , range( 10 ) , 100 ) ; // returns 145

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The reduction of the elements of iterable.

params.name: initializer
params.description: The initial value of the reduction.

return.description: The reduction of the elements of iterable.

name: src/_sum.js
_sum
description:
Sums the elements of the input iterable. An optional initializer parameter
allows to start the sum of the elements at a chosen value.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The sum of the initializer with the elements of iterable.

params.name: initializer
params.description: The initial value of the sum.

return.description: The sum of the initializer with the elements of iterable.

name: src/all.js
all
description: Returns true if all of the elements of the input iterable are truthy.
examples: all( chain( [ nrepeat( true , 10 ) , repeat( false ) ) ) ; // returns false

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Returns true if all element of iterable are truthy, false otherwise.

return.description: Returns true if all element of iterable are truthy, false otherwise.

name: src/any.js
any
description: Returns true if any of the elements of the input iterable is truthy.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Returns true if any element of iterable is truthy, false otherwise.

return.description: Returns true if any element of iterable is truthy, false otherwise.

name: src/index.js
src/max.js
max
description:
Returns the largest element of the input iterable according
to some comparison function.
examples: max( ( a , b ) => a - b , range( 10 ) ) ; // returns 9
max( ( a , b ) => a - b , range( 0 ) ) ; // returns undefined

unknown.tagValue: {Object} The largest element of iterable according to compare.

params.name: compare
params.description:
The comparison function to use. This function
must be 2-ary. It must return -1, 0, or 1 depending whether the first
parameter is, respectively, less than, equal to, or greater than the second
parameter.

params.name: dflt
params.description:
The default value to return in the case
that the input iterable is empty.

return.description: The largest element of iterable according to compare.

name: src/min.js
min
description:
Returns the smallest element of the input iterable according
to some comparison function.
examples: min( ( a , b ) => a - b , range( 10 ) ) ; // returns 0
min( ( a , b ) => a - b , range( 0 ) ) ; // returns undefined

unknown.tagValue: {Object} The smallest element of iterable according to compare.

params.name: compare
params.description:
The comparison function to use. This function
must be 2-ary. It must return -1, 0, or 1 depending whether the first
parameter is, respectively, less than, equal to, or greater than the second
parameter.

params.name: dflt
params.description:
The default value to return in the case
that the input iterable is empty.

return.description: The smallest element of iterable according to compare.

name: src/reduce.js
reduce
description:
Applies the accumulator function iteratively on the last return value of the
accumulator and the next value in the input iterable. The initial value is
the initializer parameter. If no initial value is given, the first element
of the input iterable is used.
examples: _reduce( ( x , y ) => x + y , range( 10 ) , 0 ) ; // returns 45
_reduce( ( x , y ) => x + y , range( 10 ) , 100 ) ; // returns 145

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The reduction of the elements of iterable.

params.name: initializer
params.description: The initial value of the reduction.

return.description: The reduction of the elements of iterable.

name: src/some.js
some
description:
Returns true if at least some of the elements of the input iterable are
truthy.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Returns true if at least n elements of iterable are truthy, false otherwise.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of elements that should be truthy.

return.description: Returns true if at least n elements of iterable are truthy, false otherwise.

name: src/sum.js
content: import _sum from './_sum.js'; /** * Sums the elements of the input iterable. An optional initializer parameter * allows to start the sum of the elements at a chosen value. The default value * for the initializer parameter is 0. * * @example * sum( range( 10 ) ) ; // returns 45 * * @example * sum( range( 10 ) , 100 ) ; // returns 145 * * @param {Iterable} iterable - The input iterable. * @param {Object} [initializer=0] - The initial value of the sum. * @returns {Object} - The sum of the initializer with the elements of * iterable. * */ export default function sum(iterable, initializer = 0) { return _sum(iterable, initializer); }

name: sum
description: Sums the elements of the input iterable. An optional initializer parameter allows to start the sum of the elements at a chosen value. The default value for the initializer parameter is 0.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - The sum of the initializer with the elements of iterable.

params.name: initializer
params.description: The initial value of the sum.

return.description: The sum of the initializer with the elements of iterable.

content:
:bowl_with_spoon: [@iterable-iterator/reduce](https://iterable-iterator.github.io/reduce)
==

Iterable reducers for JavaScript.
See [docs](https://iterable-iterator.github.io/reduce/index.html).

> :warning: Depending on your environment, the code may require
> `regeneratorRuntime` to be defined, for instance by importing
> [regenerator-runtime/runtime](https://www.npmjs.com/package/regenerator-runtime).

```js
import {range} from '@iterable-iterator/range';
import {reduce} from '@iterable-iterator/reduce';
import {mul, add} from '@functional-abstraction/operator';

reduce( mul , range( 2 , 6 ) , 1 ) ; // 120
reduce( add , range( 2 , 6 ) , 1 ) ; // 15

import {sum} from '@iterable-iterator/reduce';
sum( range( 6 ) ) ; // 15

import {any, all, some} from '@iterable-iterator/reduce';
any( [ false* , true , ... ] ) ; // T
any( [ false* ] ) ; // F
all( [ true* , false , ... ] ) ; // F
all( [ true* ] ) ; // T
some( [ true , true , false , true , ... ] , 3 ) ; // T
some( [ true , false , true , false* ] , 3 ) ; // F

import {increasing, decreasing} from "@total-order/primitive" ;
import {min, max} from '@iterable-iterator/reduce';
min( increasing , [ 2 , 1 , 3 ] ) ; // 1
max( increasing , [ 2 , 1 , 3 ] ) ; // 3
```

[![Dependencies](https://img.shields.io/david/iterable-iterator/reduce.svg)](https://david-dm.org/iterable-iterator/reduce)

name: ./README.md
package.json
./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation

Can be managed using
[yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs),
[npm](https://docs.npmjs.com),
or [jspm](https://jspm.org/docs).


### yarn
```terminal
yarn add @iterable-iterator/reduce
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @iterable-iterator/reduce --save
```

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@iterable-iterator/reduce
```

name: ./doc/manual/usage.md
